intro: Phaulanthus acuminatissimus, commonly known as the narrowleaf phaulanthus, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to drought conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs, aiding in water conservation. The flowers are small and yellow, appearing in clusters, and bloom during the spring and summer seasons.
